titles.title: Zelda no Densetsu: Mugen no Sunadokei
The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition
ゼルダの伝説 夢幻の砂時計
The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass

title: Zelda no Densetsu: Mugen no Sunadokei
title_english: The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass
title_japanese: ゼルダの伝説 夢幻の砂時計
title_synonyms: The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition
synopsis:
Link is a boisterous boy who actively searches for adventure. To seek those thrills, he joins a pirate ship led by the tomboy captain, Tetra. While at sea, Tetra and her crew come across a dilapidated ship covered in a dark fog. Possibly rumored to be the feared Ghost Ship, Tetra jumps to the mysterious vessel, only to disappear. Link tries to run over to her aid, but he falls into the water and loses consciousness.

Link awakens on the shores of Meruka Island to the cries of a fairy named Ciela, and he is taken to the fairy's grandfather, Oshus. Oshus tells the boy that a sailor named Linebeck might be able to help him find his missing friend. However, when Link and Ciela find Linebeck in the Temple of the Ocean King, they become suspicious of his intentions. Nevertheless, Link will need Linebeck's ship to travel across the seas and gather the Hourglass of Dreams' Sands of Time in order to save Tetra.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]
background: Zelda no Densetsu: Mugen no Sunadokei adapts the 2007 Nintendo DS game The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass. The series was published in English as The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass by VIZ Media under the VIZ Kids imprint on September 7, 2010. It was included in the complete The Legend of Zelda 10-volume box set published on October 25, 2011. The manga rereleased with Zelda no Densetsu: Fushigi no Boushi as the fourth volume of VIZ Media's The Legend of Zelda: Legendary Edition on May 9, 2017.
